meanings.definition: To clean or wipe with a sponge.
meanings.sent1: She sponged the table to make it shiny.
meanings.sent2: I sponged the spill on the floor to clean it up.
meanings.sent3: He sponged the dishes quickly before his mom came home.
meanings.sent4: The rain sponged away the footprints on the path.
meanings.sent5: The artist sponged the canvas to create a textured effect.

meanings.definition: To absorb or soak up with a sponge.
meanings.sent1: The sponge sponged up all the water from the sink.
meanings.sent2: I sponged the excess oil from the surface of the soup.
meanings.sent3: The sponge sponged the spilled milk in no time.
meanings.sent4: The dry soil sponged the rainwater quickly.
meanings.sent5: She sponged the spilled juice with a quick motion.

meanings.definition: To borrow or take without permission.
meanings.sent1: He sponged some money from his sister's wallet.
meanings.sent2: She sponged a pen from the office without asking.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky raccoon sponged some food from the campsite.
meanings.sent4: The student sponged the idea for his project from a book.
meanings.sent5: The thief sponged the valuable necklace from the jewelry store.
